arm_group.description: Rapid genotyping to select optimal P2Y12-inhibitor for PCI.
The use of platelet function testing to select the optimal P2Y12-inhibitor for PCI.
Regular approach for performing elective PCI.

brief_summary.textblock:
Patients undergoing percutaneous coronary intervention with a residual high platelet
      reactivity despite oral clopidogrel are at increased risk of ischaemic complications. The
      strategies to overcome the issue consist of switch to a more potent antiplatelet medications
      including prasugrel or ticagrelor. Economic constrains of many countries still do not allow
      wide reimbursement of newer antiplatelet agents. Therefore a strategy to personalise
      treatment according to genotype and phenotype characteristics of the patient may provide an
      attractive solution combining high clinical efficacy with low budget impact.

clinical_study.brief_title: Bedside Genetic or Pharmacodynamic Testing to Prevent Periprocedural Myonecrosis During PCI (ONSIDE TEST)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  age 18-75

          -  elective PCI

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  acute coronary syndrome (troponin > 1 x ULN),

          -  administration of glycoprotein IIb/IIIa inhibitors,

          -  chronic total occlusion,

          -  lesions with extensive calcifications requiring rotational atherectomy,

          -  platelet count <70 000 /µl

          -  high bleeding risk,

          -  coronary bypass surgery in the previous 3 months,

          -  severe chronic renal failure (eGFR < 30 mL/min)

          -  requirement for warfarin, dabigatran, apixaban, rivaroxaban

          -  history of stroke or TIA,

          -  weight < 60 kg

          -  known bleeding diathesis,

          -  hematocrit of < 30% or >52%

          -  pregnancy

intervention.description: Patients harboring CYP2C19 *2 alleles receive 60 mg prasugrel for PCI, while non-carriers receive 600 mg clopidogrel if not pretreated with clopidogrel.
intervention.other_name: Spartan rapid genotyping device to screen CYP2C19 *2 carriage in patients in the Genotyping Arm.

intervention.description: Patients having high on-treatment platelet reactivity (HPR: greater than 208 PRU) receive 60 mg prasugrel loading dose (LD), others continue clopidogrel for PCI.
intervention.other_name: VerifyNow P2Y12 assay to test the response to clopidogrel.

facility.name: 1st Department of Cardiology, Medical University of Warsaw

clinical_study.official_title: Optimal P2Y12-receptor treatmeNt Guided by bedSIDe Genetic or Pharmacodynamic TESTing to Prevent Periprocedural Myonecrosis During Elective Percutaneous Coronary Intervention.

other_outcome.description: The level of peak troponin-I elevation during 24 hours of elective PCI
The rate of peri-procedural MI defined as a peak troponin-I value greater than 5x the ULN within 24 hours.
other_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients with peri-procedural MI

other_outcome.description: BARC-defined type 3 (clinical, laboratory, and/or imaging evidence of bleeding, with healthcare provider responses) and type 5 (fatal) bleeds happening within 7 days of PCI.
The rate of cardiac death, myocardial infarction, definite or probable stent thrombosis or urgent repeat revascularization within 30 days of elective PCI.
other_outcome.measure: Death, MI, stent thrombosis (ST) or urgent repeat revascularization

primary_outcome.description: The maximum level of CK-MB elevation within 24 hours of elective PCI.
primary_outcome.measure: Peak creatine kinase muscle brain (CK-MB) elevation
primary_outcome.time_frame: Within 24 hours after Percutaneous Coronary Intervention (PCI)

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Periprocedural MI is defined as a CK-MB elevation greater than 3x of the upper limit of norm (ULN) within 24 hours of elective PCI.
secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients having periprocedural myocardial infarction (MI)

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Prevention
